Chris Bingham

CTO, Switzerland & AWS Ambassador, Fujitsu

Managing Geospatial Open Data Serverlessly: paddelbuch.ch

Over the last few years, I've built paddelbuch.ch; an open source, open data project which publishes mapping data for the Swiss paddle sports community.
With the goal of a zero ops, (nearly) zero cost system, serverless was the obvious technology approach. However, this was not without its ups and downs!
Let's take a journey together through the technical successes, service issues, and open source perils which are the paddelbuch.ch story so far.

  • https://cloudypandas.ch/

Bio

Chris Bingham, a seasoned cloud strategist and architect and CTO of Fujitsu in Switzerland, was one of the first AWS-certified Solution Architects. With over 23 years of experience, including 12 years working exclusively on cloud topics, Chris partners with businesses seeking to leverage the cloud to craft strategies which deliver their long-term objectives. His expertise encompasses critical areas such as data center-to-cloud migrations, data analytics platforms, modern application architectures, and regulatory compliance in multiple industries.
